titleproper.value:
Guide to the "With the Abraham Lincoln Brigade in Spain" Film
                    <num>FILMS.014</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Tamiment staff

publisher.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2014-08-26T16:02-0400</date>

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

unittitle.value: "With the Abraham Lincoln Brigade in Spain" Film.

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: Collection consists of an original 16 mm projection print of “With The Lincoln Brigade in Spain”-- a 1938 documentary directed by Henri Cartier–Bresson that was used to raise funds for the Abraham Lincoln Brigade—and film and video copies derived from this print.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Collection name; Collection number; box number; reel, video, or DVD number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Cary Nelson donated the film to Tamiment in 2004. The accession number associated with this collection is 2012.048.

• Salas, Juan. “Henri Cartier-Bresson Film Found in ALBA Archive.” The Volunteer 17 (2010): 8-9,11. Accessed July 3, 2012. http://www.albavolunteer.org/2010/03/henri-cartier-bresson-footage-%E2%80%A8found-in-alba-archive/

The collection consists of film elements (an original 16mm projection print, a 35mm preservation duplicate negative derived from the 16mm projection print, and a 35 mm preservation projection print struck from the 35 mm preservation duplicate negative); film-to- video transfers (from the 35 mm preservation projection print to a digital betacam master and a duplicate digital betacam); and DVDs (masters and access copies dubbed from the digital betacam master).

corpname.value: Veterans of the Abraham Lincoln Brigade.
